Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ftp.file

Class AnonymousFTPHandlerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ftp.file.AnonymousFTPHandlerFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FTPConnectionHandlerFactory
    public class AnonymousFTPHandlerFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements FTPConnectionHandlerFactory
    Factory for creating AnonymousFTPHandler instances for public file access.

    This factory creates FTP handlers that provide anonymous access:

    • Anonymous login (username: "anonymous" or "ftp")
    • Email address as password (traditional anonymous FTP)
    • Read-only file system access
    • Public file distribution functionality

    Configuration Parameters:

    • rootDirectory: Root directory for public files
    • welcomeMessage: Custom welcome message (optional)

    Typical Use Cases:

    • Public software distribution servers
    • Document sharing portals
    • Open source project file repositories
    • Anonymous file download services
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

      • setRootDirectory

        public void setRootDirectory​(java.lang.String rootDirectory)
        Sets the root directory for anonymous access. This directory will be the "/" directory for all anonymous FTP connections.
        Parameters:
        rootDirectory - the root directory path for public files

      • getRootDirectory

        public java.lang.String getRootDirectory()
        Gets the configured root directory.

      • setWelcomeMessage

        public void setWelcomeMessage​(java.lang.String welcomeMessage)
        Sets a custom welcome message for anonymous users. If not set, a default message will be used.
        Parameters:
        welcomeMessage - custom welcome message

      • getWelcomeMessage

        public java.lang.String getWelcomeMessage()
        Gets the configured welcome message.

      • createHandler

        public FTPConnectionHandler createHandler()
        Description copied from interface: FTPConnectionHandlerFactory
        Creates a new instance of FTPConnectionHandler. This method is called for every new FTP connection.
        Specified by:
        createHandler in interface FTPConnectionHandlerFactory
        Returns:
        a new, uninitialized FTPConnectionHandler instance
